column3: Why is it incompatible? In the output above there is 1 error due to `Wc++11-narrowing` and 1 warning due to `Wbraced-scalar-init`. When the latter is disabled the warning is not shown. I don't see the relation (incompatibility) between the two options.\n\nOTOH, `F({a})` looks wrong, I would like the compiler to point it to me so that I can fix it to `F(a)`, no?

Is the intention to use `F({a})` with `Wc++11-narrowing` to get a warning for passing "incompatible" types? Could the same be achieved by `F(a)` with `Wimplicit-int-conversion` and/or `Wsign-conversion`?
> OTOH, F({a}) looks wrong, I would like the compiler to point it to me so that I can fix it to F(a), no?\n\n`F(a)` will disable `-Wc++11-narrowing`.
> Could the same be achieved by F(a) with Wimplicit-int-conversion and/or Wsign-conversion?\n\nIt is currently not possible to compile Bitcoin Core with either of those settings.

<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->
